definition: to visit relatives
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
parent/one's own (flesh and blood)/relative/related/marriage/bride/close/intimate/in person/first-hand/in favor of/pro-/to kiss/(Internet slang) dear
parents-in-law of one's offspring
variant of 戚[qi1]/grief/sorrow
variant of 慼|戚[qi1]
relative/parent/grief/sorrow/battle-axe
surname Qi

sentences.english: I do not like to visit relative for I feel boring.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜好走亲戚我以为那太烦了。

sentences.english: Whenever we go back to the place my wife was born, we always have to make the rounds of her relatives.
sentences.chinese: 每次去我妻子的老家，我们都得一家一家地走亲戚。

sentences.english: After celebrating at home, my parents used to take me to visit some of our relatives.
sentences.chinese: 在家里过完年以后，我父母会带我去走亲戚。

sentences.english: Previously, during the holidays, two relatives to buy two chicken.
sentences.chinese: 以前，在过节时，二人走亲戚买两只烧鸡。

definition: to visit one's friends and relatives
to celebrate the Chinese New Year
to call on sb/to drop in/to visit sb's home
erhua variant of 串門|串门[chuan4 men2]
see 串門|串门[chuan4 men2]
to pay a New Year call/to wish sb a Happy New Year
(of a family) to come together at lunar New Year's Eve/family reunion at New Year's
to call on friends and relations (idiom)
to shop in preparation for Chinese New Year
(of a wife) to return to her parental home/(fig.) to return to one's old place, job, school etc
at the Chinese New Year or other festivities
a relative (i.e. family relation)/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
(of a wife) to visit one's parental home
to pay respects during a festival
to go back to one's roots/to return to one's native place/by ext. to join one's ancestors (i.e. to die)
to go to market/to go to a fair
